alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Blair; Cambria; Fulton; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 3:02AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT BEDFORD...CENTRAL FULTON... NORTHEASTERN SOMERSET...SOUTHWESTERN BLAIR AND SOUTHWESTERN CAMBRIA COUNTIES THROUGH 400 AM EDT... At 301 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles west of Johnstown to Westmont to near Windber to 16 miles east of Somerset to 11 miles southwest of Bedford. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Johnstown, Westmont, Windber, Bedford, Belmont, Portage, Breezewood, Roaring Spring, Geistown, Southmont, Clearville, New Enterprise, Everett, Claysburg, Vinco, Dale, East Conemaugh, McConnellsburg, Osterburg and Salix-Beauty Line Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM EDT for south central Pennsylvania.
